com.uttt.common.game

Enum Rules.Constraint

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Rules.Constraint>
      • com.uttt.common.game.Rules.Constraint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Rules.Constraint>
    Enclosing class:
    Rules

    static enum Rules.Constraint
extends java.lang.Enum<Rules.Constraint>
    TODO:SLINTZ+JAVADOC: com.uttt.common.game.Rules

    In the following definitions, a "LINEAGE" is a sequence of positions from the board's top level all the way to one of it's sub-boards. The lineage of all positions cont. Thus, a height=1 board never has any lineage for any played spot. For a hight=2 board, the lineage is always only a single top-board position referencing a specific bottom board.

    For taller boards, the lineage would include a top-board position representing a mid-board, then a position in that mid-board representing a deeper mid-board, etc. until reaching a mid-board just above the bottom- boards.

    • NONE - A move places no constraint on the next move.
    • LINEAGE_GRAFT - The contraint is.
    • LINEAGE_FLOAT - .
    • DRILL_DOWN - Use the move's row/col within the top-board to determine the constrained mid-board. Then, within that mid-board, further narrow the constraint by selecting the sub-board with the move's row/col. Continue narrowing the contraint until reaching a bottom-board.
